speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: SCENE II. OLIVIA's house.

speaker: OLIVIA
text_entry: Enter MARIA and Clown

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Nay, I prithee, put on this gown and this beard;

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: make him believe thou art Sir Topas the curate: do

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: it quickly; I'll call Sir Toby the whilst.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Well, I'll put it on, and I will dissemble myself

speaker: Clown
text_entry: in't; and I would I were the first that ever

speaker: Clown
text_entry: dissembled in such a gown. I am not tall enough to

speaker: Clown
text_entry: become the function well, nor lean enough to be

speaker: Clown
text_entry: thought a good student; but to be said an honest man

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and a good housekeeper goes as fairly as to say a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: careful man and a great scholar. The competitors enter.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Enter SIR TOBY BELCH and MARIA

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Jove bless thee, master Parson.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Bonos dies, Sir Toby: for, as the old hermit of

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Prague, that never saw pen and ink, very wittily

speaker: Clown
text_entry: said to a niece of King Gorboduc, 'That that is is;'

speaker: Clown
text_entry: so I, being Master Parson, am Master Parson; for,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: what is 'that' but 'that,' and 'is' but 'is'?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: To him, Sir Topas.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: What, ho, I say! peace in this prison!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: The knave counterfeits well; a good knave.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: [Within]  Who calls there?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Sir Topas the curate, who comes to visit Malvolio

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the lunatic.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sir Topas, Sir Topas, good Sir Topas, go to my lady.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Out, hyperbolical fiend! how vexest thou this man!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: talkest thou nothing but of ladies?

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Well said, Master Parson.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sir Topas, never was man thus wronged: good Sir

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Topas, do not think I am mad: they have laid me

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: here in hideous darkness.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Fie, thou dishonest Satan! I call thee by the most

speaker: Clown
text_entry: modest terms; for I am one of those gentle ones

speaker: Clown
text_entry: that will use the devil himself with courtesy:

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sayest thou that house is dark?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: As hell, Sir Topas.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Why it hath bay windows transparent as barricadoes,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: and the clearstores toward the south north are as

speaker: Clown
text_entry: lustrous as ebony; and yet complainest thou of

speaker: Clown
text_entry: obstruction?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I am not mad, Sir Topas: I say to you, this house is dark.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Madman, thou errest: I say, there is no darkness

speaker: Clown
text_entry: but ignorance; in which thou art more puzzled than

speaker: Clown
text_entry: the Egyptians in their fog.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I say, this house is as dark as ignorance, though

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: ignorance were as dark as hell; and I say, there

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: was never man thus abused. I am no more mad than you

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: are: make the trial of it in any constant question.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: What is the opinion of Pythagoras concerning wild fowl?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: That the soul of our grandam might haply inhabit a bird.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: What thinkest thou of his opinion?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: I think nobly of the soul, and no way approve his opinion.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Fare thee well. Remain thou still in darkness:

speaker: Clown
text_entry: thou shalt hold the opinion of Pythagoras ere I will

speaker: Clown
text_entry: allow of thy wits, and fear to kill a woodcock, lest

speaker: Clown
text_entry: thou dispossess the soul of thy grandam. Fare thee well.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sir Topas, Sir Topas!

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: My most exquisite Sir Topas!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Nay, I am for all waters.

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: Thou mightst have done this without thy beard and

speaker: MARIA
text_entry: gown: he sees thee not.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: To him in thine own voice, and bring me word how

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: thou findest him: I would we were well rid of this

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: knavery. If he may be conveniently delivered, I

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: would he were, for I am now so far in offence with

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: my niece that I cannot pursue with any safety this

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: sport to the upshot. Come by and by to my chamber.

speaker: SIR TOBY BELCH
text_entry: Exeunt SIR TOBY BELCH and MARIA

speaker: Clown
text_entry: [Singing]

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'Hey, Robin, jolly Robin,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Tell me how thy lady does.'

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'My lady is unkind, perdy.'

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'Alas, why is she so?'

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool, I say!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: 'She loves another'--Who calls, ha?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Good fool, as ever thou wilt deserve well at my

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: hand, help me to a candle, and pen, ink and paper:

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: as I am a gentleman, I will live to be thankful to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: thee for't.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Master Malvolio?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Ay, good fool.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Alas, sir, how fell you besides your five wits?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool, there was never a man so notoriously abused: I

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: am as well in my wits, fool, as thou art.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: But as well? then you are mad indeed, if you be no

speaker: Clown
text_entry: better in your wits than a fool.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: They have here propertied me; keep me in darkness,

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: send ministers to me, asses, and do all they can to

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: face me out of my wits.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Advise you what you say; the minister is here.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Malvolio, Malvolio, thy wits the heavens restore!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: endeavour thyself to sleep, and leave thy vain

speaker: Clown
text_entry: bibble babble.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Sir Topas!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Maintain no words with him, good fellow. Who, I,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: sir? not I, sir. God be wi' you, good Sir Topas.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Merry, amen. I will, sir, I will.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool, fool, fool, I say!

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Alas, sir, be patient. What say you sir? I am

speaker: Clown
text_entry: shent for speaking to you.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Good fool, help me to some light and some paper: I

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: tell thee, I am as well in my wits as any man in Illyria.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Well-a-day that you were, sir

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: By this hand, I am. Good fool, some ink, paper and

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: light; and convey what I will set down to my lady:

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: it shall advantage thee more than ever the bearing

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: of letter did.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I will help you to't. But tell me true, are you

speaker: Clown
text_entry: not mad indeed? or do you but counterfeit?

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Believe me, I am not; I tell thee true.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Nay, I'll ne'er believe a madman till I see his

speaker: Clown
text_entry: brains. I will fetch you light and paper and ink.

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: Fool, I'll requite it in the highest degree: I

speaker: MALVOLIO
text_entry: prithee, be gone.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: [Singing]

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I am gone, sir,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: And anon, sir,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I'll be with you again,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: In a trice,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Like to the old Vice,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Your need to sustain;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Who, with dagger of lath,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: In his rage and his wrath,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Cries, ah, ha! to the devil:

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Like a mad lad,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Pare thy nails, dad;

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Adieu, good man devil.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit
